title: Utkarsh Micro Finance cuts micro loan rate to 24%
text: Utkarsh Micro Finance cuts micro loan rate to 24% By ET Bureau | 22 Aug, 2015, 03.52AM IST ET SPECIAL: Love visual aspect of news? Enjoy this exclusive slideshows treat! KOLKATA: Varanasi-based Utkarsh Micro Finance has reduced lending rate for micro loans by one percentage point to 24%. "The reduction in rate of interest is as per the mission to pass on the benefits of economies of scale and lower operating cost to the clients," Utkarsh managing director and chief executive Govind Singh said. Utkarsh, which has applied for a small finance bank licence, said its margin was 8.98% as on March 31, 2015. As per the Reserve Bank of India guidelines, NBFC-MFIs are allowed to have maximum margin of 10%. Last month, Arohan Financial Services reduced lending rate by 55 basis points to 25.70% a year. Arohan, a part of the Intellecap Group, reduced the rate in step with reduction in its cost of borrowing, a company executive had said.
